segments.source_content: This week, the Remix team announced some big news. Microsoft has also made it easier to try out TypeScript Go rewriting.
In the React Native world, there were a few minor but interesting releases, and the App.js config starts tomorrow. Seb will have more to tell you about it next week.

## ğŸ’¸ Sponsor {#sponsor1}
[![AG Charts: The best React Charts in the world.](/emails/issues/236/adgrid.jpg)](https://www.ag-grid.com/charts?utm_source=thisweekinreact&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=2025-email-1)
**[AG Charts: The best React Charts in the world.](https://www.ag-grid.com/charts?utm_source=thisweekinreact&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=2025-email-1)**

AG Charts is a canvas-based charting library from AG Grid. Initially built to power [AG Grids](https://www.ag-grid.com/react-table?utm_source=thisweekinreact&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=2025-email-1) Integrated Charts, AG Charts now has over **1 million** npm downloads/month:

segments.source_content:
- ğŸ†“ **Free:** Access a range of chart types, including **bar**, **line**, **scatter**, **area**, and more â€“ completely **free**, forever.
- ğŸš€ **Fast:** Using **batch drawing** and advanced change detection alongside the **offscreen canvas API**, AG Charts can easily render hundreds of thousands of data points out of the box
- ğŸ“Š **Financial Charts:** Build interactive financial charts featuring advanced annotations with just 3 lines of code.
- ğŸ¢ **Enterprise Features:** Upgrade to Enterprise to unlock advanced capabilities such as animations, context menus, crosshairs and more. Try it for free, no trial license required.

## âš›ï¸ React {#react}
[![Wake up Remix](/emails/issues/236/remix.jpg)](https://remix.run/blog/wake-up-remix)
**[Wake up Remix - The plan for Remix v3](https://remix.run/blog/wake-up-remix)**

This week you might have heard a rumor about [Remix moving on from React](https://x.com/AdamRackis/status/1925646909345058818). Ryan and Michael just published an official post describing the future of Remix.

translations.zh-hant: æœ¬é€±æ‚¨å¯èƒ½è½èé—œæ–¼ [Remix å°‡æ£„ç”¨ React](https://x.com/AdamRackis/status/1925646909345058818) çš„å‚³è¨€ã€‚Ryan å’Œ Michael å‰›ç™¼å¸ƒå®˜æ–¹æ–‡ç« é—¡è¿° Remix çš„æœªä¾†ã€‚

segments.source_content: In a nutshell, React Router will still be fully maintained and a safe bet. In parallel, Remix v3 will be a new framework based on a fork of Preact, so that they control the full stack.

translations.zh-hant: ç°¡è¨€ä¹‹ï¼ŒReact Router ä»å°‡ç²å¾—å®Œæ•´ç¶­è­·ä¸”å®‰å…¨å¯é ã€‚åŒæ™‚ï¼ŒRemix v3 å°‡æˆç‚ºåŸºæ–¼ Preact åˆ†æ”¯çš„æ–°æ¡†æ¶ï¼Œä»¥å¯¦ç¾å…¨æŠ€è¡“æ£§æŒæ§ã€‚

segments.source_content: Their goal with Remix v3 is â€œreimagining what a web framework can beâ€. The post describes the guiding principles this new framework will follow (optimize for LLMs, build on Web APIs, compositionâ€¦)

segments.source_content:
- ğŸ’¸ [Product for Engineers - This is why you're not shipping](https://go.posthog.com/twir-may28)
- ğŸ“œ [The Beauty of TanStack Router](https://tkdodo.eu/blog/the-beauty-of-tan-stack-router): Dominik goes through the features that differentiate Tanstack Router: Type-safe routing with StrictOrFrom principle, Search Param State Management, File-Based Routing, and Suspense support.
- ğŸ“œ [Composing Server and Client Components: The Modern React's Superpower](https://www.epicreact.dev/composing-server-and-client-components-the-modern-reacts-superpower-08yn9): RSC contrasts sharply with the old days of script tags and global variables.
- ğŸ“œ [Why React Error Boundaries Aren't Just Try/Catch for Components](https://www.epicreact.dev/why-react-error-boundaries-arent-just-try-catch-for-components-i6e2l): They are declarative components that only catch render errors. This article shares various pragmatic tips such as using `react-error-boundary` package or how to plug a retry button.
- ğŸ“œ [Next.js Server Actions are public-facing API endpoints](https://growl.dev/blog/nextjs-server-actions/): Server Actions can be called from Curl commands, the action ids can easily leak. They should be treated with the same security precautions as traditional public API endpoints.
- ğŸ“œ [Your React Meta-Framework Feels Broken, Here's Why](https://rwsdk.com/blog/your-react-meta-framework-feels-broken): RedwoodSDK tries to remove useless abstraction layers, conventions and other magic things that exist in Next.js and Remix.
- ğŸ“œ [Building with React Server Components and Client Components in RedwoodSDK](https://rwsdk.com/blog/react-rsc-redwoodsdk)
- ğŸ“œ [SolidJS for React Developers](https://marmelab.com/blog/2025/05/28/solidjs-for-react-developper.html)

- ğŸ“œ [Why Composition Beats Inheritance In React](https://thetshaped.dev/p/why-composition-beats-inheritance-react-projects-extensible-components)
- ğŸ’¸ [The Road to Next - Master Full-Stack Web Development with Next.js 15 and React 19](https://www.road-to-next.com/?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=this_week_in_react_1.1)

- ğŸ“¦ [Storybook 9.0](https://github.com/storybookjs/storybook/releases/tag/v9.0.0): After many betas/RCs, it's finally out, but no official blog post yet.
- ğŸ“¦ [TanStack Query v5.77](https://github.com/TanStack/query/releases/tag/v5.77.0): Adds `maxChunks` to keep in the cache for streamed queries.

**[Getting started with Clerk Billing](https://go.clerk.com/KfnV7Rj)**
Learn how to build a complete billing experience with Clerkâ€”no custom UI, webhooks, or Stripe session management required.

segments.source_content:
- Create a pricing page with the `<PricingTable />` component
- Connect with Stripeâ€”no manual API calls, no manual syncing
- Manage plans and entitlements all within the Clerk dashboard
- `has()` helper to control access based on a customerâ€™s plan, features, and permissions
- Manage user and subscription data all in one place

segments.source_content: ## ğŸ”€ Other {#other}

- ğŸ“œ [TypeScript Native Previews](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/typescript/announcing-typescript-native-previews/): Microsoft announced the go rewrite of TypeScript a few months ago. Nightly builds for this rewrite will now be published, and can be used with a CLI or a VS Code extension. JSX support has been added, and itâ€™s still \~10 times faster than the JS version.
- ğŸ“œ [Do Not Assert on Requests](https://www.epicweb.dev/do-not-assert-on-requests): The creator of msw explains what he recommends instead of checking the body/header of sent requests in tests
